column11: Review Text
Building was nice and well maintained but appears more commercial than religious. Still very active so be respectful if services are in progress when visiting.

St Lucia’s Cathedral is a large building, still in use.  A service was underway when we got there.  It was a blessing of the school children, looked really good.  There is also a shrine to Mary in the car park.

the road going up to the cathedral is a one way and we had reached probably during the school end time so it got a little crowded. but the cathedral exudes beauty and peace once you are inside it. a lovely place to visit.

From the outside, this cathedral looks more like an office building than a cathedral.  Went inside, said my prayers and took some pictures. Outside there were young boys playing some games. The Security Guard pointed to us the statue of Mary at the front area of this Cathedral. The pink building is the school and residence of the nuns according to this Security Guard.
Out of the fifteen cathedrals that make up one of the main parishes of Sri Lanka, St. Lucia’s Cathedral is named after Saint Lucy. Located in the north-eastern part of Colombo
One of the oldest church in the town but still beautifully maintained. Millitary band performace here is very good.
This is one of the oldest church and Sri Lanka and beautifully maintained. Recently renovated as well.

This is definitely not - seen one cathedral seen them all. The place is bustling with worshipers, lighting candles, hanging flowers. The entire area is unique and walking distance is a huge Hindu Kovil.
One of the oldest Catholic Church in Sri Lanka. Great to experience military band performance here..
We visited St Lucia's cathedral on a recent cruise call to Colombo. It was very similar to other Catholic churches throughout the world.
One of the oldest catholic churches in the heart of Colombo. Can spend any amount of time praying, no one will disturb you.
Large catholic cathedral on outskirts of city centre. Well maintained with good stained glass windows.
One of the Cathedral Pope John Paul visited and offered service for a limited audience, silent place surrounded with plenty schools and housings.
One of the best architectured Church in Colombo, Sri Lanka . Well maintained and peaceful place to pray. very quite and carmful places.

This is one of the old Dutch church build by Dutch seaman and it is is highly attractive among tourists , It is situated in Colombo, Kotahena and it is very close to the famous St Anthony's church in Colombo (not more than 1 km). This is the only big Cathedral in Sri Lanka.  It is really a colossal church in Sri Lanka and named among the biggest church too. From the angels guarding its car park entrance to the many iconic figures featured throughout its interior, this cathedral is impressive. It also featured one of the most ornate baptismal fonts that I have seen in churches of any denomination. St Lucia's Catholic Cathedral is for the most part hidden but but once in view is spectacular with its grand steps leading to an impressive interior. The cathedral is worth a visit and traces its origins to the Dutch who colonized Sri Lanka in the 1700's. Recently the renovated Cathedral is an architectural beauty. It is the main church of the Roman Catholics in Colombo. It is easily accessible with ample parking and it is a good place to visit. Its statue there was believed to be reached from a floating device. This is the best Cathedral in Sri Lanka. Looks so much similar to St. Peter's Basilica. It is calm and quiet and good to sit  and just wait. The architecture is beautifully crafted and the admin staff is friendly. This church still reminding about Ceylon past, all the Colombo old buildings were build by British people. This Church is well maintained and preserved to a very great level. I really salute the beautiful giant building.Pope John Paul II also visited in 1994 and conducted a holy mass . St. Lucia’s Cathedral has a very quiet atmosphere inside the cathedral considering its location. Sri Lankans of all faiths go to this church and make "wows" that they will fulfill if their prayers are answered. Working model of a pipe organ is visible but is not used now.I highly recommend the St. Lucias Cathedral. I loved this Church. Although some of the seats and kneeling structures are not working, I love to just sit and reflect inside this Church. Go and see this beautiful church and it is worth your visit when you visit Colombo. You can feed the poor people around the church. I have for ten years mostly visited this church continuously during Christmas eve. Spirits are high during mid-night mass and it is amazing to see the Royal Military band playing on these occasions.
I loved this Church. Although some of the seats and kneelers are not working, I love to just sit and reflect inside this Church. Visit this place when you visit Colombo.
This is one of the old Dutch church build by Dutch seaman. The statue there was believed to be reached from a floating device. You can feed the poor people around the church.

Active place of worship and well maintained. Amongst the largest and beautifully displayed stations of the cross that we have seen. The tall wooden Madonna and child in one of the ante rooms was really beautiful.

from the good, old days of my schooldays, where we used to play in the cathedral square till our "school buses" came, the change in status is almost funny.  i suppose this is because some "body" has realized the importance of architecture & cultural value of this monument. there are statues of a number of saints - my introduction to the repertoire of catholic saints- are beautiful & lifelike, the impression stays in your mind to continue influencing you to "be like a saint".  there are a list of DON'Ts that you have to abide by now. give the place its due respect & honour.  after all, it has stood tall & unchallenged; in between 2 great schools (st benedit's college & good shepherd convent); withstanding all rough tough youthful play in the premises & the square.  is it really a square, i wonder.
One of the best and  beautifully architectured Church in  Colombo. Well maintained and peaceful place to pray.

Its a beautiful church and worth a visit.  I have for ten years visited this church continuously during christmas eve. Spirits are high during mid night mass and its amazing to see the Royal military band playing on the occasion . The place is worth visiting and I got the chance since my close friend stays just round the corner near the church and from the home window as well you can see the church clearly.

St Lucia’s Cathedral is one of the largest Churches in Colombo and we visited it when there was a Mass in progress. It was lovely to behold as the church was filled with totally white clad school children and even their priests wore white. There was a lovely school choir singing during the Mass, so if you choose to visit this church, then go during a Mass to hear the choir singing. There is however, restricted access to this church during certain hours of the day, so to be certain of entry, check opening times before arriving. There is plenty of parking available outside the church.

This is the best Cathedral in Sri Lanka. Looks so much similar to St. Peter's Basilica... Calm and quite and good to sit back and just wait... Beautifully crafted architecture and friendly admin staff...

Located in the old part of Colombo city this building is an imposing sight.  From the angels guarding its car park entrance to the many iconic figures featured throughout its interior, this cathedral is impressive.  It also featured one of the most ornate baptismal fonts that I have seen in churches of any denomination.  Very quiet atmosphere inside the cathedral considering its location.  Highly recommended.

St. Lucy of Sicily is the patron saint of St. Lucia’s Cathedral in the area of Colombo. She is regarded as the savior of impaired vision. On December 13 each year, a feast is held in her honor. Legend has it that she extracted her eyes to repulse the attentions of an unwanted admirer who greatly admired her lovely eyes. Later, her eyes were restored, more beautiful than before, through a miracle.
A place to spend time with Prayer and antic and ancient architect make you feel that one of the Church that you should visit

Sri Lankans of all faiths go to this church and make "wows"that they will fulfill if their prayers are answered.  (When I was a school boy in Sri Lanka I used to go every Tuesday but my prayers were not answered!)

Situated in a predominantly Catholic area on a higher elevation. This Portuguese inspired worshiping church is very famous among many church goers. Due to the easy access and ample parking space many choose this for their functions. Church Service is considered High Mass but the local choir is not good as the service.
Went by to visit the Cathedral and found a very interesting cloth christmas tree in front .Glad to see that some one is being creative reusing bits of material.

This is highly attractive amoung tourists , its situated in colombo and very close to the famous St Anthony's church in colombo (not more than 1km). this is the only chathedral in SL . Pope John Paul II also visited in 1994 and conducted a holy mass . its really a colosal church in SL and among the biggest church too.

Visited in the afternoon to discover it is closed from 1pm to 3pm. Went back after lunch. Very peaceful inside with a lot of statues of different saints. There was a wedding to take place in the evening so the cathedral was decorated with flowers. Also got to see a bit of a Sri Lankan wedding. You are not allowed to talk inside so very serene and peaceful. Worth a visit!

In comparison to Sri Lankan temples this cathedral could seem a bit on the plain side. But definitely worth a visit. Talking is banned inside, so it is very peaceful and perfect if you want a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

A visit to Kotahena proved to be surprising.  St Lucia's Catholic Cathedral is for the most part hidden but but once in view is spectacular with its grand steps leading to an impressive interior.  The cathedral is worth a visit and traces its origins to the Dutch who colonised Sri Lanka in the 1700s.
when you in there you will feel you are in some were Europe,not in sri lanka ,the arts and the  surroundings   are very different in there

Recently renovated Cathedral is a architectural beauty. It is the main church of the Roman Catholics in Colombo. A working model of a pipe organ is visible but is not used now. Situated in Kotahena and  Easily accessible with ample parking. A good place to visit.
If you want to see how they build churches in late 1800's , then this is the place to be. an ancient Church in excellent condition.
This cathedral is a nice place to meditate and see the fantastic architecture of colonial time. Holy Masses are conducted in Sinhala, Tamil and English languages.

Creating the illusion of ascending to the heavens, St. Lucia’s Cathedral stands tall with its rich history and architectural value – with the majesty of its dome, the gracefulness of its vault and its breathtaking stained glass windows. Established since 1760, what sets it apart is not just its overwhelming vastness, but as a very special place of prayer and worship. Today, St. Lucia’s Cathedral is the spiritual centre of the Roman Catholic Church of the Colombo Archdiocese. Its spiritual atmosphere, shaped by the legacy left behind by early Oratarian Missionaries, is what gives devotees a deep closeness to God. It continues to nourish those who have sought comfort within her walls. I hope that your visit to our website gives you a sense of the beauty and historical value of the Cathedral. We also take great pleasure in warmly inviting you to personally visit this grand edifice that has stood the test of time.
This is the largest Cathedrial in Colombo. If you are a Catholic you must visit. If you have any trouble with your Eyes this is the Miraculous place. If you pray St. Lucia will definitely grant you.

After spending a busy day on Monday 26/08/13 with my Tuk Tuk driver he suggested we visit St Lucia's Cathedral towards the end of the day, being exhausted due to the heat & visiting many other interesting places I was happy to know this was almost my last sightseeing place for the day, my feet felt heavy after so much walking. Arrived around 4pm at the Cathedral and very quite with only a handful of local people, the atmosphere was quiet and relaxed, my Tuk Tuk driver was happy to take some pics of me looking around. Personally I felt the Cathedral was more impressive inside than the outside !!!! Stayed around 40 min's and so glad I visited this beautiful Cathedral, worth visiting for all ages.
